channel.title: [Czar] Pickup Command [Czar]
channel.description: Well everytime I want to spawn an item I have to put a 0 depending on how big the ID is. Example: 5, I have to do ::pickup 00005 1 Another Example: 14638, I have to do ::pickup 14368 1 (The whole code has to be 5 #s) How can I fix this?

item.title: [Czar] Pickup Command [Czar]
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

[quote=“RuneSpace, post:1, topic:372357”]Pretty sure this is czar

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("AMPONG TAMPONG DAMPONG GIN GONG DING DONG RANKS!")) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } else { sendMessage("usage Use as ::pickup 800 100"); } } [/quote]
It worked! Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: [Czar] Pickup Command [Czar]
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

Use this

 if (command.startsWith("pickup") && && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("usernamehere!")) {
            try {
                int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
                int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

                if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                    addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
                } else {
                    sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
                }
            } catch (Exception e) {
                sendMessage("message! ");
            }
        }

Read full topic

item.title: [Czar] Pickup Command [Czar]

item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

Well everytime I want to spawn an item I have to put a 0 depending on how big the ID is.
Example: 5, I have to do ::pickup 00005 1
Another Example: 14638, I have to do ::pickup 14368 1
(The whole code has to be 5 #s)
How can I fix this?
